verses.text: 大衛王老了，年事已高，他們雖用許多衣服蓋著他，他仍不感到暖和。

words.note: Combination of the name 'David' and 'King'
Lit. 'years' matters already high'

verses.heading: Adonijah Tries to Seize the Throne

verses.text: 所以他的臣僕對他說：「不如為我主我王尋找一個年輕的處女，使她侍候在王面前，照顧王，睡在王的懷中，好使我主我王得到暖和。」

words.note: Refers to royal subjects or officials who serve a ruler.
A respectful collective address for a king.
Specifically refers to a virgin woman in religious contexts.
Often implies attending to someone of higher status.
Refers to the chest or lap area, a place of intimacy.
A respectful collective address for a king.

verses.text: 於是他們在以色列全境尋找一個美貌的少女，結果找著了一個書念的女子亞比煞，就把她帶到王面前。
這少女極其美麗。她照顧王，服事他，可是王沒有與她發生過關係。

words.note: Often used for serving in a religious or formal capacity.
Contextually implies intimate or sexual relations.

verses.text: 那時哈及的兒子亞多尼雅妄自尊大，說：「我必作王。」就為自己預備了戰車、騎兵，又有五十人在他前面奔走。

words.note: To presumptuously glorify or magnify oneself.

verses.text: 他的父親從來沒有責難他說：「你為甚麼這樣作呢？」他的容貌也很英俊，他是在押沙龍之後生的。
亞多尼雅與洗魯雅的兒子約押和亞比亞他祭司商議以後，二人都答應支持他。

words.note: Refers to a minister of religious rites.

verses.text: 但撒督祭司、耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅，拿單先知、示每、利以和大衛的勇士都不擁護亞多尼雅。

words.note: Refers to a minister of religious rites.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Often refers to 'mighty men' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 有一天，亞多尼雅在隱．羅結旁邊，瑣希列的磐石那裡，宰殺牛羊和肥畜，邀請他所有的兄弟，就是王的眾子和所有作王的臣僕的猶大人，來參加筵席。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for foundation or strength in scripture.
Refers to animals raised for sacrifice or feasting.
Emphasizes 'all' the sons, often referring to a royal lineage.
Refers to those serving in royal courts or government.
A formal meal with many guests.

verses.text: 只是沒有邀請拿單先知、比拿雅、眾勇士和他的兄弟所羅門。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Emphasizes 'all' of David's mighty men.

verses.text: 拿單對所羅門的母親拔示巴說：「哈及的兒子亞多尼雅作了王，而我們的主大衛還不知道，你難道沒有聽見嗎？

words.note: Refers to God or a master/ruler, often capitalized in biblical context.
Used to ask rhetorical questions, implying the answer is obvious.
Resultative verb compound: 'listen and perceive'.

verses.text: 現在你來，我可以給你出一個主意，好救你的性命和你兒子所羅門的性命。

words.note: More formal and often used in religious/ancient texts than '生命'.
More formal and often used in religious/ancient texts than '生命'.

verses.text: 你進去見大衛王，對他說：『我主我王，你不是曾經向婢女起誓，說：「你的兒子所羅門必接續我作王，他要坐在我的王位上」嗎？現在為甚麼亞多尼雅作了王呢？』

words.note: A formal address, 'my lord'.
A formal address, 'my king'.
An archaic term for a female servant.

verses.text: 你還在那裡與王說話的時候，我會隨後進來，證實你的話。」
於是拔示巴進到內室去見王。王很老了，書念的女子亞比煞正在服事王。

words.note: Refers to a private room, often in a palace or temple.

verses.text: 拔示巴向王俯伏叩拜，王問：「你要甚麼？」

words.note: A deep bow or prostration as a sign of respect/worship.

verses.text: 她回答說：「我主啊，你曾經指著耶和華你的 神向婢女起誓，說：『你的兒子所羅門必接續我作王，他要坐在我的王位上』，

words.note: A respectful address to a superior.
Here, meaning 'swearing by' someone/something.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
The elevated space indicates reverence for God.
Combined with '作' (zuò) to mean 'to reign as king'.
Used with '在' to indicate location.

verses.text: 可是，現在亞多尼雅作了王了；而我主我王，你還不知道。

words.note: Indicates a new situation or realization.
Often paired with '我主' as a respectful address.

verses.text: 他宰殺了許多公牛、肥畜和羊，邀請了王所有的兒子、亞比亞他祭司和軍隊的元帥約押，卻沒有邀請王的僕人所羅門。

words.note: Often refers to slaughtering livestock for sacrifice or food.
Refers to animals fattened for sacrifice or feasting.
A high-ranking military officer.
Often used in a formal or respectful sense in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 我主我王啊，現在以色列眾人的眼睛都看著你，等你告訴他們誰要坐在我主我王的王位上，接續你作王。

words.note: A formal address, combining 'my lord' and 'my king'.
Refers to the people or nation of Israel.
Used with '在' to indicate location.
Combined with '作' (zuò) to mean 'to reign as king'.

verses.text: 否則，到我主我王與列祖同睡之後，我和我的兒子所羅門就要被算為罪人了。」

words.note: Refers to past generations, especially patriarchs.
A biblical idiom for dying and being buried with one's ancestors.

verses.text: 拔示巴還在與王說話的時候，拿單先知就進來了。

words.definition: be at, in; indicating ongoing action

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 有人告訴王說：「拿單先知來了。」拿單來到王面前，向王叩拜。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
A gesture of deep respect or submission.

verses.text: 拿單說：「我主我王啊，你曾說過：『亞多尼雅要接續我作王，坐在我的王位上』嗎？
今天他下去宰殺了許多公牛、肥畜和羊，又請了王所有的兒子、眾軍長和亞比亞他祭司。他們正在亞多尼雅面前又吃又喝，說：『亞多尼雅王萬歲。』

words.note: Refers to animals prepared for sacrifice or feast.
An idiomatic phrase describing continuous eating and drinking.
A traditional acclamation wishing long life to an emperor or king.

verses.text: 只有我，就是你的僕人，撒督祭司、耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅和你的僕人所羅門，他都沒有邀請。

words.note: Lit. 'slave person'
Refers to the group of people just mentioned.

verses.text: 我主我王是不是作了這事，而你沒有告訴你的眾臣僕，誰要接續我主我王，坐你的王位呢？」
大衛回答說：「召拔示巴到我這裡來。」於是拔示巴來到王面前，站在那裡。
verses.heading: David Picks Solomon as His Successor

verses.text: 王就起誓說：「我指著曾經救我的性命脫離一切患難的永活的耶和華起誓，

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, often translated as LORD.

verses.text: 我從前怎樣指著耶和華以色列的 神向你起誓，說：『你的兒子所羅門必接續我作王，要坐在我的王位上』，我今天也必照樣行。」

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, often translated as LORD.
Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles when referring to the LORD.

verses.text: 於是拔示巴面伏在地，向王叩拜，說：「願我主大衛王萬歲！」

words.note: A posture of deep reverence or submission.
A traditional gesture of deep respect or worship.
Lit. 'ten thousand years', a traditional acclamation for a ruler.

verses.text: 大衛王又說：「召撒督祭司、拿單先知和耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅到我這裡來。」他們都來到王面前。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 王就對他們說：「你們要帶著你們主人的僕人，使我的兒子所羅門騎上我的騾子，送他下到基訓去。
在那裡撒督祭司和拿單先知要膏立他作以色列的王。你們要吹角說：『所羅門王萬歲！』

words.note: Lit. 'ten thousand years', a traditional acclamation for a ruler.

verses.text: 然後你們要跟隨他上來；他要來坐在我的王位上；他要接續我作王。我已經立了他作以色列和猶大的統治者。」
耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅回答王說：「阿們！願耶和華我主我王的 神也是這樣說。

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew 'amen'
The Hebrew name for God
Refers to the Supreme Being in this context.

verses.text: 耶和華怎樣與我主我王同在，願他也照樣與所羅門同在，使他的王位，比我主大衛王的王位更偉大。」

words.note: The Hebrew name for God

verses.text: 於是撒督祭司、拿單先知和耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅，以及基利提人和比利提人都下去，使所羅門騎上大衛王的騾子，送他到基訓去。
撒督祭司從帳幕裡拿出那盛膏油的角，膏立所羅門；然後有人吹角，眾民就說：「所羅門王萬歲！」

words.note: Refers to a shofar or container made from a horn.
Specifically to appoint by anointing with oil.
V-O compound, referring to blowing a musical or signal horn.
A traditional acclamation for an emperor or monarch.

verses.text: 眾民都跟隨他上去，吹著笛子，十分歡樂，以致大地也因他們的聲音震裂。

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 亞多尼雅和所有與他在一起的賓客剛剛吃完了飯，聽到這聲音；約押聽到角聲，就說：「城裡為甚麼有這樣喧嚷的聲音呢？」

words.note: Specifically refers to the sound of a shofar or trumpet in a biblical context.

verses.text: 他還在說話的時候，亞比亞他祭司的兒子約拿單來了。亞多尼雅對他說：「進來吧！你是個忠義的人，一定帶來了好消息。」

words.note: Indicates an action is ongoing.
Historically significant for religious roles.
Similar to '福音' (gospel) but more general.

verses.text: 約拿單對亞多尼雅說：「不好了，我們的主大衛王已經立了所羅門為王了。

words.note: Commonly used for God or a sovereign leader in the Bible.

verses.text: 王差派撒督祭司、拿單先知和耶何耶大的兒子比拿雅，以及基利提人和比利提人，與所羅門同去。他們使所羅門騎上王的騾子。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first', implying divine revelation.
A group of mercenaries, part of David's guard.
A group of mercenaries, part of David's guard.

verses.text: 撒督祭司和拿單先知已經在基訓膏立他作王。眾人都從那裡歡歡喜喜上路；你們聽見的聲音，就是城裡的喧鬧聲。

words.note: To anoint and establish (a king or priest) in a religious ceremony.
Reduplication emphasizes the degree of joy.

verses.text: 不但所羅門已經坐在這王國的王位上，

words.note: Used as a locative particle following a noun.

verses.text: 而且王的臣僕也來為我們的主大衛王祝福說：『願你的 神使所羅門的名聲比你的更尊榮，使他的王位比你的更偉大。』王就在床上屈身下拜。

words.note: Refers to royal officials or subjects.
A respectful title for rulers or deities.
The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Describes a state of being highly honored and glorified.
Used as a locative particle following a noun.
Implies bowing very low in reverence or submission.

verses.text: 王又這樣說：『耶和華以色列的 神是應當稱頌的，因為他今天賜了一人坐在我的王位上，也使我親眼看見這事。』」

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Used to form an adjectival phrase or nominalize a verb.
Often used for gifts from superiors or divine beings.
Used as a locative particle following a noun.

verses.text: 亞多尼雅所有的賓客都懼怕，大家起身，各自逃走了。

words.note: Often implies intense or reverent fear.

verses.text: 亞多尼雅懼怕所羅門，就起來，去抓緊祭壇的角。

words.note: Often implies intense or reverent fear.
Refers to the projections at the corners of the altar.

verses.text: 有人告訴所羅門說：「亞多尼雅懼怕所羅門王。他現在抓緊祭壇的角說：『願所羅門王今天向我起誓，決不會用刀殺死他的僕人。』」

words.note: A platform for religious sacrifice.
Altar horns were traditional places of refuge.
Verb-complement structure meaning 'kill to death'.

verses.text: 所羅門說：「他若是作一個忠義的人，他的頭髮連一根也不會掉在地上；但在他身上若是發現有甚麼惡行，他必定死。」
於是所羅門派人去把亞多尼雅從祭壇上帶下來。他來向所羅門叩拜；所羅門對他說：「回你的家去吧！」

words.note: Indicates the object is acted upon and moved or changed.
A platform for religious sacrifice.
Here indicates direction away from the speaker.
